授業目的: This is a hands-on, student presentation class. Web and Society expands a broad variety of definitions. In this class we will be exploring the evolution of our digital society from the human-computer-human interactions point of view as opposed to the most common computer-computer perspective. We will explore up-to-date, wave-maker technologies, services and companies that provide non-real-time social interactions such as Twitter, Path, Mixi, Facebook, Wii, XBox, iPhone, iPad Google Phone XBox Kinect, Oculus, HTC Vive, Magic Leap, Microsoft Hololens and much, much more. We will also explore more recent technologies that support real-time social interactions such as e-sports, social networking systems (Instagram, TikTok), false news, deep fakes, and social communities such as Second Life.
到達目標:
Students will be able to:
1) Understand the th evolution of our digital society from the human-computer-human interactions point of view
2) Understand the impact of current technologies in our society
3) Understand and predict what and how current technologies might change our lives in the near future
4) Understand who are the shakers and movers that are making the greatest contribution to our digital society
授業方法: オンライン形式で実施。主に学生発表、個人及びチーム・プロジェクトを含む。

トピック.授業計画1:
As our digital intercommunication environments rapidly evolves, it is hard to provide as week-by-week description of the course contents. The course is based on student presentations, selected by the students themselves. Teams of two will be organized and will present their research findings on the aspects of the chosen subect that affect our digital world. The following is a tentative schedule for 15 weeks of student presentations:

1. Course introduction
